TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ValidatingPropertiesEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

remarks.format:
## Remarks You create an event handler for the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService.ValidatingProperties> event to customize how profile property values are validated. The <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService.ValidatingProperties> event is raised when profile properties are set for a user. If any property values fail validation, add them to the collection in the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ValidatingPropertiesEventArgs.FailedProperties%2A> property. The <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService.SetPropertiesForCurrentUser%2A> method returns the collection in the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ValidatingPropertiesEventArgs.FailedProperties%2A> property so that you can determine which properties failed validation.
## Examples The following example shows an event handler for the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService.ValidatingProperties> event. When the value passed for `FirstName` property is empty or `null`, the `FirstName` property is added to the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ValidatingPropertiesEventArgs.FailedProperties%2A> collection.
[!code-vb[System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.application_2_1.asax)] [!code-cs[System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.application_2_1.asax)]

Docs.summary: Gets the collection that contains profile properties that have failed validation.
Docs.value: The profile properties that have failed validation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The FailedProperties property contains a collection of the names of the properties that have failed validation. If you create an event handler for the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService.ValidatingProperties> event, you add the names of the properties that fail validation to the collection in the FailedProperties property. The <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService.SetPropertiesForCurrentUser%2A> method returns the collection in the FailedProperties property so that you can determine which properties failed validation.
## Examples The following example shows an event handler for the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService.ValidatingProperties> event. When the value passed for `FirstName` property is empty or `null`, the `FirstName` property is added to the FailedProperties collection.
[!code-vb[System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.application_7_1.asax)] [!code-cs[System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.application_7_1.asax)]

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of names and values of the profile properties to validate.
Docs.value: The names and values of the profile properties to validate.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Properties property returns an <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> object that contains the names and values of the profile properties to set for the user. If you create an event handler for the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService.ValidatingProperties> event, you can retrieve the properties to validate from the Properties property. If any values fail validation, add them to the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ValidatingPropertiesEventArgs.FailedProperties%2A> property. The <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService.SetPropertiesForCurrentUser%2A> method returns the collection in the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ValidatingPropertiesEventArgs.FailedProperties%2A> property so that you can determine which properties failed validation.
## Examples The following example shows an event handler for the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService.ValidatingProperties> event. When the value passed for `FirstName` property is empty or `null`, the `FirstName` property is added to the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ValidatingPropertiesEventArgs.FailedProperties%2A> collection.
[!code-vb[System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.application_8_1.asax)] [!code-cs[System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.application_8_1.asax)]
